name: perforce
description: (2020 Fork) Perforce integration with VS Code's SCM features

viewsWelcome.contents:
Perforce
No perforce client workspace detected for the open folder(s)

Perforce
Looking for perforce client workspaces...

Perforce
Open a folder to detect perforce client workspaces

[Check the Perforce Output Logs](command:perforce.showOutput)
For more help:
[Read the Perforce Setup Guide](https://github.com/mjcrouch/vscode-perforce#setup)
Note: A possible perforce client was detected, but the open folder is not within the client root, and vice versa. [Check the output log](command:perforce.showOutput) for client names and paths
Note: P4CONFIG is not set in your environment, so P4CONFIG files will not be detected

perforce.bottleneck.maxConcurrent.description: How many perforce commands can be executing at the same time. This is intended to prevent the extension from overloading the perforce server if many files are modified at the same time. Further commands will be queued until the number of running commands reduces. Use 0 for unlimited (not recommended)

perforce.debugModeActive.description: When enabled, logs information about command throttling to the javascript console (open with 'Toggle Developer Tools')

perforce.debugP4Commands.description: When enabled, logs all perforce commands and their output to the javascript console (open with 'Toggle Developer Tools'). This may be a *lot* of output and will include raw passwords if present

perforce.activationMode.description: Controls when to activate the SCM Provider and P4 status bar icon. Requires a restart to take effect
enumDescriptions: Always try to activate the the SCM provider and P4 status icon
Only activate the SCM provider when a perforce client is found in the workspace

perforce.scm.activateOnFileOpen.description: Controls whether the extension attempts to create an SCM provider each time a file outside of a known perforce client workspace is opened

perforce.scm.deactivateOnFileClose.description: Controls whether an SCM provider is de-activated when there are no more related files or folders open in the editor

perforce.editOnFileSave.description: Automatically open a file for edit when saved

perforce.editOnFileModified.description: Automatically open a file for edit when Modified

perforce.addOnFileCreate.description: Automatically Add a file to depot when Created

perforce.deleteOnFileDelete.description: Automatically delete a file from depot when deleted

perforce.annotate.followBranches.description: Whether to follow branch actions when annotating a file

perforce.annotate.gutterColumns.description:
EXPERIMENTAL - SUBJECT TO CHANGE
The format for displaying summary text for perforce annotations.
Each line represents a column, followed by its default length.

The following flags may appear before the column name, IN THIS ORDER:
   -> : align text to the right, when the text does not fill the column (preceding fields will reclaim spaces)
   {text} : prefix text with the value in curly braces
   ... : truncate the text from the beginning, instead of the end

The following columns are supported:
revision, chnum, user, client, description, timeAgo

For example, a column '{@}...user|5' will turn the username 'Xavier' into '@…vier'

perforce.client.description: Overrides any P4CLIENT setting with the specified client name

perforce.user.description: Overrides any P4USER, USER, or USERNAME setting with the specified user name

perforce.port.description: Overrides any P4PORT setting with the specified protocol:host:port

perforce.password.description: Overrides any P4PASSWD setting with the specified password

perforce.dir.description: Overrides any PWD setting (current working directory) and replaces it with the specified directory. This item should NOT normally be used - it is only useful in very specific cases, typically when the vs code workspace contains filesystem links to an actual perforce client workspace.

perforce.command.description: Configure a path to p4 or an alternate command if needed

perforce.resolve.p4editor.description:
Overrides P4EDITOR when running resolve commands, allowing you to use a different editor to edit the merge file. Use an empty value to not override.

Use `code --wait` to resolve files in vscode. When editing a merge file in vscode, save the file and close it to continue the resolve.

IMPORTANT: `code --wait` DOES NOT APPEAR TO WORK AS A P4EDITOR ON WINDOWS

perforce.countBadge.description: Controls the badge counter for Perforce
enumDescriptions: Include all files in count except for shelved files (default)

perforce.changelistOrder.description: Specifies the direction of the chnagelist sorting

perforce.scmFileChanges.description: Open file changes when selected in SCM Explorer

perforce.maxFilePerCommand.description: Specify the maximum number of file should be processed in a single command line (doesn't include changelist operations). Default is 32

perforce.realpath.description: Try to resolve real file path before executing command.

perforce.ignoredChangelistPrefix.description: Specifies the prefix of the changelists to be ignored.

enum: hide changelists, hide files in default changelist
enumDescriptions: hide changelists that contain ONLY non-workspace files. Show non-workspace files in other changelists
hide changelists that contain ONLY non-workspace files. Show non-workspace files in other changelists, except the default changelist
show all changelists, but hide all non-workspace files within them (see WARNING)
perforce.hideNonWorkspaceFiles.description:
Controls how files outside of the current VS Code workspace are shown in the SCM Provider.

Note: even if you open non-workspace files in the editor, they will not be considered as workspace files.

WARNING: If you select to hide all non-workspace files, and then submit changelists other than the default, it will submit files that are not visible! It is recommended to hide changelists instead

enumDescriptions: Always sync the whole perforce client workspace (i.e. perform a bare p4 sync), even if the VS Code workspace is only a subset of the perforce client workspace

Only sync the workspace folder(s) that are open in VS Code (i.e. perform a p4 sync with a set of paths). NOTE: If you open a file from the same client but outside of the VS Code workspace, this will NOT be synced. If you open a file from another perforce client and the SCM provider is auto detected, the WHOLE perforce client will be synced
perforce.syncMode.description: Controls the set of files to sync when using the default sync command. If you use a very large perforce client workspace and only open a small part of it in VS Code, this can prevent accidentally syncing a large number of files

perforce.hideShelvedFiles.description: Don't show the shelved files in the Source Control section.

perforce.hideEmptyChangelists.description: Don't show changelists without any file in the Source Control section.

perforce.fileShelveMode.description: Controls the behaviour when shelving / unshelving an individual file
enumDescriptions: When shelving, always try to revert the open file. When unshelving, always try to delete the shelved file
When shelving, never try to revert the open file. When unshelving, never try to delete the shelved file
When shelving, prompt for whether to revert the open file. When unshelving, prompt for whether to delete the shelved file

perforce.swarmHost.description:
Specifies the host of the Swarm server, allowing you to open the review for a changelist from the SCM provider, annotations and the changelist quick pick. Include the protocol, e.g. https://my_swarm_host

If you use another changelist-based review tool, enter the full URL for a review request, including the term `${chnum}`, which will be replaced with the changelist number. e.g. http://reviews/search/?q=${chnum}

perforce.hideSubmitIcon.description: Don't show the submit icon next to the changelist description.

perforce.promptBeforeSubmit.description: Whether to prompt for confirmation, before submitting a saved changelist

enumDescriptions: Show the previous button on all perforce files and files with a known status in perforce
Only show the previous button when already looking at a diff (it's still possible to diff previous from the extended context menu)
Never show the previous / next buttons (it's still possible to navigate diffs from the extended context menu)
perforce.editorButtons.diffPrevAndNext.description: When to show buttons on the editor title menu for diffing the next / previous revision

perforce.enableP4ConfigScanOnStartup.description: Whether to scan the workspace for perforce P4CONFIG files, in order to find perforce clients to show in the SCM Provider view. Disabling this setting is NOT generally recommeded, but if you have a very large workspace containing many directories, and you do NOT have P4CONFIG files outside of the workspace root, this can reduce startup time

perforce.warnOnMissingP4CONFIG.description: When enabled, if a .p4config file is found in the workspace, but P4CONFIG is not set in the environment, a warning will be shown. This is due to a change in behaviour of handling these files in v4 which may break backward compatibility

perforce.changelistSearch.maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to return in the changelist search

perforce.explorer.showSyncCommands.description: Whether to show sync commands on the explorer context menu

perforce.explorer.showBasicOpCommands.description: Whether to show basic operation commands on the explorer context menu (add / edit / revert)

perforce.explorer.showFileOpCommands.description: Whether to show file operation commands on the explorer context menu (move / rename etc)

perforce.specEditor.showIndentWarning.description: Whether to show a warning when editing a change or job spec and the editor is set to use spaces instead of tabs

commands.title: Add - Open the current file to add it to the depot
Edit - Open the current file for edit
Edit and Save - Open the current file for edit, and then save it
Revert - Discard changes from the current file
Sync file - Sync the open file to the latest revision
Sync file revision - Sync the open file to a specific revision
Diff - Display diff of client file with depot file
Diff revision - Display diff of client file with depot file at a specific revision
Annotate - Print file lines and their revisions in the gutter
Move - Move or Rename the open file
Opened - Display 'open' files, and open one in the editor
Show actions for this revision of the depot file
Refresh this search without changing filters
Pin results (keep until they are manually deleted)
Refresh job spec from perforce (overwrites local edits)
Refresh change spec from perforce (overwrites local edits)

scm/resourceGroup/context.when: scmProvider == perforce && scmResourceGroup == default && config.perforce.hideSubmitIcon == false
scmProvider == perforce && scmResourceGroup != default && config.perforce.hideSubmitIcon == false

editor/title.when: !isInDiffEditor && perforce.currentFile.status != OPEN && perforce.currentFile.status != NOT_OPEN && config.perforce.editorButtons.diffPrevAndNext =~ /All/ && resourceScheme == perforce
!isInDiffEditor && perforce.currentFile.status != OPEN && perforce.currentFile.status != NOT_OPEN && resourceScheme == perforce

colors.description: Specifies the background color of the gutter blame annotations
Specifies the foreground color of the gutter blame annotations
Specifies the background color of the associated line highlights in annotations
Specifies the overview ruler color of the associated line highlights in annotations
File decoration color for files open for add
File decoration color for files open for move / add
File decoration color for files open for branch
File decoration color for files open for archive
File decoration color for files open for delete
File decoration color for files open for move/delete
File decoration color for files open for purge
File decoration color for files open for edit
File decoration color for files open for integrate
File decoration color for files open for import
File decoration color for files open for lock
File decoration color for unresolved files

scripts.test: npm run unittest-nocompile && npm run integrationtest-nocompile
scripts.unittest: npm run pretest && npm run unittest-nocompile
scripts.integrationtest: npm run pretest && npm run integrationtest-nocompile
